definition: lit. quick sword cuts through tangled hemp (idiom); decisive action in a complex situation/cutting the Gordian knot
rapid/quick/speed/rate/soon/almost/to make haste/clever/sharp (of knives or wits)/forthright/plainspoken/gratified/pleased/pleasant
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
surname Dao
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
generic name for hemp, flax etc/hemp or flax fiber for textile materials/sesame/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/(of materials) rough or coarse/pocked/pitted/to have pins and needles or tingling/to feel numb
surname Ma

sentences.english: He never procrastinates , but always takes resolute measures to solve a complicated problem in an instant.
sentences.chinese: 他幹什麼事總是快刀斬亂麻，從不拖泥帶水。

sentences.english: Often say "cut the Gordian knot" and the knife can continue, but more threads.
sentences.chinese: 常說“快刀斬亂麻”，可這一刀下去，頭緒卻更多了。

sentences.english: He could cut through disputes with the sharp knife of authority.
sentences.chinese: 他可以運用他的權威象快刀斬亂麻樣地解決糾紛。

definition: (idiom) to lose one's head/to panic/to go to pieces
to play the fool (idiom)/to feign madness
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
equivocal/ambiguous
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
annoying/disgusting
written repentance
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to get straight to the point (idiom)
foolish talk/nonsense
using a wicker basket to draw water (idiom); wasted effort
paper wedding (first year wedding anniversary)
to mention/to bring up (a subject)/with regard to/as for
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
